purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation and classification of management data that may apply to product and activity data. This module combines the functionality of the following modules to provide the capability to classify and represent management data.
The module provides the ability for other modules to assign management information to product and activity data. Such management information comprises:

In some cases this information is applied to the management data. For example, to specify who specified the security classification for some product data and when, requires the assignment of person and organization, and date and time to the security classification assignment.
The module provides for a classification of an attribute on an EXPRESS entity. The standard values used by the classification are defined as Classes .
purpose.note: The definition of the may be stored in an external class library.
When the attribute of an EXPRESS entity is classified, the value of the attribute on an instance of the EXPRESS entity will be the name or identifier of the class.
purpose.p: The module provides for the assignment of classification information to product or activity data. This provides a generic capability that may be specialized and further constrained in other application modules.
The module specifies the representation of Classes that are defined external to a data exchange file in an External Class Library.
The module provides for the representation of assignments of an identifier to product or activity data.
The module enables set theory relationships between classes. This includes the following relationships:

inscope.li: facility to assign management information to product data;
facility to assign management information to activity data;
facility to assign management information to management data;
assignment of management information to management data;
the association of a value, represented by a class, to an attribute on an entity representing management information;
assignment of classification information to management information;
the identification of a class that is external to a data exchange file;
the identification of an external class library that is not in an exchange file and holds the definition for classes used in the exchange file;
a reference to a class in an external class library;
assignment of an identification to management information;

outscope.li: assignment of management information to product data;
assignment of management information to activity data;
the contents of an external class library;
the definition of a set or class; Definition of a set or class is within the scope of the Class application module.
classification and the specification of complete set membership;
class or set relationships that are not set theory relationships.

uof.name: Management_Resource_Information_Classification
uof.description: This UoF specifies the definitional information for the classification of the entities identified in .
